name: mri_synthsr
description:
FreeSurfer is a software package for the analysis and visualization of neuroimaging data from cross-sectional and longitudinal studies. It is developed by the Laboratory for Computational Neuroimaging at the Martinos Center for Biomedical Imaging.

FreeSurfer provides full processing streams for structural and functional MRI and includes tools for linear and nonlinear registration, cortical and subcortical segmentation, cortical surface reconstruction, statistical analysis of group morphometry, diffusion MRI, PET analysis, and much more. It is also the structural MRI analysis software of choice for the Human Connectome Project.

inputs.description: Image(s) to super-resolve. Can be a path to an image or to a folder.
inputs.name: Input

inputs.description: Output(s), i.e., synthetic 1mm MP-RAGE(s). Must be a folder if input is a folder.
inputs.name: Output

inputs.description: Use this flag for CT scans in Hounsfield scale, it clips intensities to [0,80].
inputs.name: CT Flag

inputs.description: Use this flag to disable unsharp masking.
inputs.name: Disable Sharpening Flag

inputs.description: Use this flag to disable flipping augmentation at test time.
inputs.name: Disable Flipping Flag

inputs.description: Use model for low-field scans (e.g., acquired with Hyperfine's Swoop scanner).
inputs.name: Low Field Flag

inputs.description: Number of cores to be used. Default is 1.
inputs.name: Threads

inputs.description: Enforce running with CPU rather than GPU.
inputs.name: CPU Flag

author: FreeSurfer Developers
